content.description: There are 700 people in line for a popular amusement-park ride when the ride begins operation in the morning. Once it begins operation, the ride accepts passengers until the park closes 8 hours later. While there is a line, people move onto the ride at a rate of 800 people per hour. The graph above shows the rate, r(t) , at which people arrive at the ride throughout the day. Time t is measured in hours from the time the ride begins operation.
content.question:
Is the number of people waiting in line to get on the ride

increasing or decreasing between t=2 and t=3? Justify your answer.

frqParts.text:
Is the number of people waiting in line to get on the ride

increasing or decreasing between t=2 and t=3? Justify your answer.

topic.text: 4.1: Interpreting the Meaning of the Derivative in Context

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
